image.altText: Lachie Neale high fives fans watching Brisbane's training session

props.synopsis: Geelong and Brisbane both finalise their team lists ahead of Saturday's AFL grand final as a couple of big names from either side are put through an emotional rollercoaster. Follow live.

title.children: Neale returns as heartbroken Lions star is ruled out of grand final

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Geelong and Brisbane's full grand final team line-ups
Neale in as Lions and Cats confirm GF teams

image.altText: A photo of a young girl

props.synopsis: Three-year-old Dio Kemp was taken to Monash Medical Centre four times over 10 days before she died of sepsis.

title.children: Monash Health provided unreasonable care before toddler death, coroner finds

image.altText: Snoop Dogg sits on a couch

props.synopsis: Snoop Dogg has strutted into the MCG for his official appearance ahead of a fascinating, somewhat controversial, AFL grand-final entertainment set.

title.children: 'It's a way of life': Snoop Dogg ready for AFL grand final

image.altText: A concept plan of a hospital with people walking in front of it

props.synopsis: An Albury Wodonga surgeon says the local health service dismissed him after he spoke out against a major redevelopment of the hospital and changes to the region's cancer centre.

title.children: Doctor says he was sacked for criticising $558m hospital rebuild

image.altText: A large, square, sandy coloured building with a sign reading "Mildura Law Courts". The sun is bright.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old Victorian man, who recorded 67 prior convictions for stalking and breaching family violence orders against his young ex-girlfriend, has failed in a bid to stay out of jail.

title.children: Violent man abandons appeal to avoid jail when told he could face more time

image.altText: The Victoria Police crest, badge, on the arm of an officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: The latest figures from Victoria's Crime Statistics Agency show the highest number of criminal incidents in at least two decades.

title.children: Victorian crime reaches record highs, new figures reveal

image.altText: a photo of a man looking at camera, standing in front of football oval

props.synopsis: The Victorian club wants to move into a different league because several clubs in the Ballarat league, including Darley, Sunbury and Melton, are much closer to Gisborne.

title.children: AFL rejects Gisborne football club move as legal threat looms

image.altText: Smiling Scott Selwood speaks to Nick Daicos, whose back is to the camera, on the boundary during training.

props.synopsis: Scott Selwood will take time away from football, stepping down as an assistant coach with Collingwood, following a year marked by personal tragedy.

title.children: Selwood steps away from football after 'personally challenging year'

image.altText: A man in glasses looks to the right of the camera with a serious expression

props.synopsis: Former AFL boss Andrew Demetriou says the public would embrace a gay men's player and rejects that the AFL is an unsafe environment.

title.children: Former AFL boss denies league is unsafe for gay men's players

image.altText: A large truck carrying neatly piled wood logs enters a large yard with thousands of large wooden logs.

props.synopsis: With biofuels earmarked as a way to power the transport sector in the future, one industry says its waste can be converted into aviation and shipping fuel.

title.children: Ambitious plan to convert forestry waste into fuel for ships and planes

image.altText: A man in a blue tracksuit and hat bowls on a green with flags of different countries flying in the background.

props.synopsis: It may not seem like the place to host a prestigious World Bowls competition, but a small Murray River town is doing just that.

title.children: World's best bowlers fight for prestigious title in small border town

image.altText: close up of newborn baby with lots of hair breastfeeding

props.synopsis: Last week a breastfeeding mother was asked to leave a Virgin Australia lounge for pumping. Experts says while there is a level of awareness that breastfeeding in public is protected, some people in the community still view it as "inappropriate".

title.children: Why are we still asking mothers to hide breastfeeding?

image.altText: Year 11 high school student with long, straight brown hair, and braces.

props.synopsis: An Indigenous high school student's essay on the Anzac Day heckling of an Indigenous elder by far-right supremacists has earned her a nationally recognised award.

title.children: 'Spectacle of disrespect' at Welcome to Country inspires teen essay

image.altText: Andrea James, an Indigenous woman in her mid-50s, with glasses and curly brown hair, poses in front of a hedge.

props.synopsis: Andrea James will take the helm of Australia's oldest Indigenous theatre company Ilbijerri, as outgoing artistic director Rachael Maza steps back after almost 18 years.

title.children: This groundbreaking theatre company shaped Andrea's career. Now she runs it

image.altText: Eggs in an egg carton.

props.synopsis: Eggs are back on supermarket shelves in abundance after shortages caused by bird flu. But do you know what labels like caged and barn-laid mean?

title.children: Do you know what you're buying when choosing between egg labels?

image.altText: Nicho Hynes of the Sharks celebrates by raising his arms above his head and pointing his index fingers towards the sky

props.synopsis: Accused by some of being too nice and not nice enough by others, polarising Cronulla star Nicho Hynes "doesn't give a rats" about criticism that comes his way anymore.

title.children: Sharks star shrugs off personal barbs in NRL title race

image.altText: A photo of a man with short brown hair.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors have flagged more potential charges for the Victorian kindergarten cleaner accused of secretly filming children in a bathroom.

title.children: Another alleged victim found in kindergarten cleaner hidden camera case

image.altText: Josh Dunkley of the Lions attempting to catch a ball from a Cats player.

props.synopsis: Wondering what time the AFL grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

title.children: Ultimate guide to the 2025 AFL grand final decider between Geelong and Brisbane

image.altText: A black and white photo of two men standing in front of a camera in the bush, one man pointing to the side.

props.synopsis: Graham White was a pioneer of Australian radio and television and played a key role in the creation of numerous television series, including A Big Country.

title.children: Man behind iconic ABC TV programs dies aged 93

image.altText: A man looks at his watch as fluid runs down a tube into his belly.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians who were injured by COVID vaccines say they are facing a 'cruel and complex' system to get compensation from the government.

title.children: Lives ruined and tears shed from Australians injured by COVID vaccines

image.altText: People on chair lift in the snow wearing ski gear

props.synopsis: The general sentiment is Australia's ski resorts are coming to the end of a bumper snow season — but is this evaluation accurate, or just positive spin after the dismal 2023 and 2024 seasons?

title.children: The real story of the 2025 snow season is no winter wonderland

image.altText: A black Tesla car drives down a wide city road. No driver sits behind the steering wheel

props.synopsis: Owners of late model Teslas can now access the company's self-driving technology. But the rules for how drivers can use it differ around the country.

title.children: Tesla's self-driving technology has landed in Australia. What are the rules?

image.altText: Lots of hands reaching for the footy against a black background.

props.synopsis: Ahead of the AFL grand final, national violence prevention organisation Our Watch is calling for the sporting community to address the increased risk of violence facing women during football finals.

title.children: Domestic violence services brace for spike on AFL grand final weekend

image.altText: Greg Swann poses with a football in front of AFL House

props.synopsis: Voting for the Brownlow Medal has been a hot topic again in the wake of Monday night's count, with the AFL open to letting umpires have access to statistics.

title.children: AFL boss hints at Brownlow change after voting controversy

image.altText: Black and white image with a wind turbine's wings at the centre, one man working on it. Two others stand infront of it.

props.synopsis: A Danish clean energy pioneer says Australia is poised for success with offshore wind, but there are lessons it can learn from abroad.

title.children: Offshore wind pioneer urges Australia to learn from UK's renewables push

image.altText: A freeze frame of a football replay on an old style TV

props.synopsis: The Purnim Bears were supposed to be the feel-good story of country football — a team uniting black and white communities. But their 1987 grand final was so violent it ended with their expulsion.

title.children: The premiership team that won it all and was banned after one perfect season

image.altText: A dark haired man in a wheelchair sits behind the open driver's door of a car.

props.synopsis: Josh Evans, who uses a wheelchair, had to turn down a job with the Bureau of Meteorology because he was unable to get NDIS funding for a vehicle to drive himself to work.

title.children: Man knocks back dream job after NDIS rejects van to drive to work

image.altText: A composite image of two boys, one in a white shirt and one in a collared shirt and dark puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: Police charge a 15-year-old boy with the murder of Dau Akueng, also 15, who was found with fatal injuries alongside his 12-year-old friend Chol Achiek in Melbourne's outer west earlier this month.

title.children: Eighth murder charge laid following boys' stabbing deaths

image.altText: A wrecked car

props.synopsis: A man has been charged following a collision in Tullamarine that left a police dog and his handler with injuries.

title.children: Victoria Police dog on the road to recovery after horror collision

image.altText: A Melbourne Storm player stands on the sidelines wearing a jacket with a hood on.

props.synopsis: Melbourne recall three big guns, led by star half Jahrome Hughes, as their NRL title hopes go on the line in Friday night's preliminary final against Cronulla.

title.children: Storm include injured star Hughes with NRL grand final on the line

image.altText: A man wears a blue shirt and grey jacket in front of a camp kitchen.

props.synopsis: Five years after devastating bushfires swept through Mallacoota, some survivors are still making do with tents and camp kitchens amid a backlog of construction jobs.

title.children: Black Summer survivors still living in horse floats and sheds years later

image.altText: An AFLW player looks serious as she walks off the field with two teammates behind her at half-time.

props.synopsis: Former AFLW player claims she was spat at during her community grand final as ex-players are being targeted at local leagues.

title.children: Former AFLW player alleges she was spat at during local league grand final

image.altText: David Barham speaks to Zach Merrett over his shoulder, both in black tie.

props.synopsis: Essendon president Dave Barham hands over his role to his understudy, continuing an off-season filled with change at the club as Zach Merrett speaks publicly for the first time on his flirtation with Hawthorn.

title.children: Bombers president steps down as Merrett apologises to fans over trade drama

image.altText: Old and new wind technology in south west Victoria

props.synopsis: VicGrid is cracking down on cowboys in the renewable energy sector, demanding that developers behave better or be refused access to the network.

title.children: VicGrid releases guidelines for renewables developers after community angst

image.altText: A Hawthorn player tackles a Geelong player from behind as they fall to the ground.

props.synopsis: The AFL tribunal quashes Mabior Chol's three-match ban for rough conduct, finding he did not act unreasonably in his tackle which left Geelong's Tom Stewart concussed and out of this weekend's grand final.

title.children: Hawthorn's Chol free to play in 2026 after three-match ban is overturned
